result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan
result.description: To comply with the provision of the Grant Agreement, this document informs About the contact persons, workflows and provisions to communicate and disseminate the project results. This document provides guidelines for all partners and includes the project webpage and other communication channels.

result.title: Description of workflow coordination
result.description: The PlaMES tool consists of various submodules that will be developed in Task 3.1, 3.2, 3.3 and 3.4. To ensure compatibility, interoperability and prepare the merge of the submodules in Task 3.5, basic processes, (data) interfaces and data formats will be defined and described.

result.title: Definition of common scenario framework, data/modelling requirements and use cases
result.description: The aim of the project is to develop a rather modular and scalable tool, the validation and exemplary application of the tool requires the definition of a specific scenario framework. This definition comprises the description (e.g. in .pptx / .docx / .xlsx format) and justification for the chosen exemplary test cases. The focus will lay on a future (e.g. 2050) scenario for a part of the European energy system (e.g. central-western Europe).

result.title: Mathematical formulation of the model
result.description: The planned approach poses a comprehensive optimization task. The first step towards implementation poses the mathematical formulation of the complete planning problem, which will be documented in detail (e.g. in .docx format).

result.title: D4.4 Knowledge Hub
result.description: This Deliverable will consist of a Knowledge Hub. The Knowledge Hub will include a collection of knowledge items from both external sources (other projects/initiatives/open innovation community) and the involved Super-Labs (validated within the pilot process) that will be structured along the phases and elements of the TSL blueprint/roadmap process to guide users through the hub. The items will be composed of material on how to integrate TSL of different domains into a unique initiative, how to coordinate their efforts/experiments and how to drive their results into actionable outputs supporting policy decisions to achieve climate neutrality. It will operate as a wise-advisory tool supporting cities/regions in evolving their domain-based innovation infrastructures into multi-domain TSLs.

project.title: Designing long-term systemic transformation frameworks for regions – Accelerating the shift towards climate neutrality

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Design and interface requirement for communication booking
result.description: It includes•Identification of the system drivers and the relevant key technical requirements.•Definition of the CONOPS/CONEMP•High-level trade-offs and retain options suitable to build up the most promising Service•Detailed design of the Coverage service including Functional and structural design, definition of workflow, critical path, internal interphases

result.title: Data ingestion, Common Information Model and semantic interoperability. First version

result.title: Marketplace design
result.description: Detailed design specifications of the OMEGA-X marketplace for energy-related data and services. This includes the identification and definition of all analytic services and digital twins together with the first iteration on the architecture for the design of the Data Space marketplace (and underlaying identity, vocabulary and infrastructure monitoring services), based on D3.1.

project.title: Orchestrating an interoperable sovereign federated Multi-vector Energy data space built on open standards and ready for GAia-X

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: Establish the grounds for a common European energy data space

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

category.title: Electrical engineering, Electronic engineering, Information engineering

programme.title: Climate, Energy and Mobility

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: Energy Systems and Grids

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: European (energy) data exchange reference architecture 3.0

details.authors: J. Mário Couto, EPRI Konstantinos Kotsalos, European Dynamics SA Kalle Kukk, Elering Antonello Monti, RWTH Aachen University and Fraunhofer FIT Javier Valino, Atos
